Detailed Description

Wrapper for POSIX reader/writer locks.

The class Barrier is a wrapper for the POSIX pthread_barrier_... functions. It implements barriers locks, i.e., a mechanism that synchronizes multiple threads.

Example Program: 

//======================================================================== 
// Project: QRTS Utility Classes
// ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
// Package: PThread Classes
// Authors: Markus Loffler  
// Start Date: Sun Apr 01 19:23:10 GMT 2001
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------  
// File: Barrier.t.cpp
// Example program for the class Barrier.
//========================================================================  
 

// ----- Standard Libaries -----
#include <iostream.h>
#include <unistd.h>

// ----- QRTS Libraries -----
#include "Barrier.hpp"



Barrier barrier(2);


//======================================================================== 
// thread
//========================================================================  

void *thread(void *data)
{
  while (1)
  {
    for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
    {
      // Doing some work
      sleep(1);
      cout << "Doing some work" << endl;
    }
  
    barrier.wait();
  }
}


//======================================================================== 
// main
//========================================================================  

int main()
{
  pthread_create(0, 0, thread, 0);
  
  while (1)
  {
    // Wait until thread has completed
    barrier.wait();
    cout << "Sync Point" << endl;
  }
}

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Barrier ( int numThreads )
 

The constructor initializes the barrier.

Parameters:
count   The number of threads that must call wait() before any of them returns from the call of wait().

~Barrier ( )
 

The destructor cleans up.

Member Function Documentation

void wait ( )
 

Synchronizes the participating threads at the barrier. This function blocks until a certain number of threads (as specified in the constructor) are calling wait().
